verses.kjv: Now the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel, (for he was the firstborn; but, forasmuch as he defiled his father’s bed, his birthright was given unto the sons of Joseph the son of Israel: and the genealogy is not to be reckoned after the birthright.
verses.ct: These are the descendants of Reuben, Israel's firstborn son. He was actually the firstborn, but because he violated his father's bed, his birthright was transferred to the sons of Joseph, Israel's son. So the genealogy is not recorded according to birthright status.

verses.kjv: For Judah prevailed above his brethren, and of him came the chief ruler; but the birthright was Joseph’s:)
verses.ct: Although Judah became the strongest among his brothers, and the ruling leader came from his line, the birthright belonged to Joseph.

verses.kjv: The sons, I say, of Reuben the firstborn of Israel were, Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
verses.ct: The sons of Reuben, Israel's firstborn, were Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

verses.kjv: The sons of Joel; Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
verses.ct: The descendants of Joel: his son Shemaiah, his son Gog, his son Shimei,

verses.kjv: Micah his son, Reaia his son, Baal his son,
verses.ct: his son Micah, his son Reaia, his son Baal,

verses.kjv: Beerah his son, whom Tilgathpilneser king of Assyria carried away captive: he was prince of the Reubenites.
verses.ct: his son Beerah, whom Tilgathpilneser king of Assyria took into exile. Beerah was a leader of the Reubenites.

verses.kjv: And his brethren by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was reckoned, were the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,
verses.ct: His relatives, listed by their clans when the genealogical records were compiled, included Jeiel as the leader, along with Zechariah,

verses.kjv: And Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who dwelt in Aroer, even unto Nebo and Baalmeon:
verses.ct: and Bela son of Azaz, son of Shema, son of Joel. Bela lived in Aroer, and his territory extended as far as Nebo and Baalmeon.

verses.kjv: And eastward he inhabited unto the entering in of the wilderness from the river Euphrates: because their cattle were multiplied in the land of Gilead.
verses.ct: To the east, he settled all the way to the edge of the desert that stretches from the Euphrates River, because their herds had grown so large in the land of Gilead.

verses.kjv: And in the days of Saul they made war with the Hagarites, who fell by their hand: and they dwelt in their tents throughout all the east land of Gilead.
verses.ct: During the reign of Saul, they waged war against the Hagarites and defeated them. Then they occupied the Hagarites' camps throughout the entire eastern region of Gilead.

verses.kjv: And the children of Gad dwelt over against them, in the land of Bashan unto Salcah:
verses.ct: The descendants of Gad lived next to them in the territory of Bashan, extending as far as Salcah.

verses.kjv: Joel the chief, and Shapham the next, and Jaanai, and Shaphat in Bashan.
verses.ct: Joel was the leader, Shapham was second, then Jaanai and Shaphat — all in Bashan.

verses.kjv: And their brethren of the house of their fathers were, Michael, and Meshullam, and Sheba, and Jorai, and Jachan, and Zia, and Heber, seven.
verses.ct: Their relatives from their ancestral families were Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jachan, Zia, and Heber — 7 in all.

verses.kjv: These are the children of Abihail the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;
verses.ct: These were the descendants of Abihail son of Huri, son of Jaroah, son of Gilead, son of Michael, son of Jeshishai, son of Jahdo, son of Buz.

verses.kjv: Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, chief of the house of their fathers.
verses.ct: Ahi son of Abdiel, son of Guni, was the head of their ancestral families.

verses.kjv: And they dwelt in Gilead in Bashan, and in her towns, and in all the suburbs of Sharon, upon their borders.
verses.ct: They lived in Gilead, in Bashan and its surrounding towns, and in all the pasturelands of Sharon as far as their borders reached.

verses.kjv: All these were reckoned by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.
verses.ct: All of these were recorded in genealogical registers during the reigns of Jotham king of Judah and Jeroboam king of Israel.

verses.kjv: The sons of Reuben, and the Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh, of valiant men, men able to bear buckler and sword, and to shoot with bow, and skilful in war, were four and forty thousand seven hundred and threescore, that went out to the war.
verses.ct: The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh had 44,760 fighting men — brave warriors trained to carry shields and swords, shoot bows, and engage in battle.

verses.kjv: And they made war with the Hagarites, with Jetur, and Nephish, and Nodab.
verses.ct: They went to war against the Hagarites, along with Jetur, Nephish, and Nodab.

verses.kjv: And they were helped against them, and the Hagarites were delivered into their hand, and all that were with them: for they cried to God in the battle, and he was intreated of them; because they put their trust in him.
verses.ct: God helped them in the fight, and the Hagarites and all their allies were handed over to them, because they called out to God during the battle and he answered their prayer since they put their trust in him.

verses.kjv: And they took away their cattle; of their camels fifty thousand, and of sheep two hundred and fifty thousand, and of asses two thousand, and of men an hundred thousand.
verses.ct: They captured the enemy's livestock: 50,000 camels, 250,000 sheep, 2,000 donkeys, and 100,000 people.

verses.kjv: For there fell down many slain, because the war was of God. And they dwelt in their steads until the captivity.
verses.ct: Many enemies were killed, because this war was directed by God. The Israelites then lived in that territory until the exile.

verses.kjv: And the children of the half tribe of Manasseh dwelt in the land: they increased from Bashan unto Baalhermon and Senir, and unto mount Hermon.
verses.ct: The members of the half-tribe of Manasseh settled in the land, spreading out from Bashan to Baalhermon, Senir, and Mount Hermon. They were numerous.

verses.kjv: And these were the heads of the house of their fathers, even Epher, and Ishi, and Eliel, and Azriel, and Jeremiah, and Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, mighty men of valour, famous men, and heads of the house of their fathers.
verses.ct: These were the heads of their ancestral families: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel. They were powerful warriors, well-known men, and leaders of their ancestral families.

verses.kjv: And they transgressed against the God of their fathers, and went a whoring after the gods of the people of the land, whom God destroyed before them.
verses.ct: But they were unfaithful to the God of their ancestors and prostituted themselves to the gods of the peoples in the land — the very peoples God had destroyed ahead of them.

verses.kjv: And the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, and the spirit of Tilgathpilneser king of Assyria, and he carried them away, even the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh, and brought them unto Halah, and Habor, and Hara, and to the river Gozan, unto this day.
verses.ct: So the God of Israel prompted the ambition of Pul king of Assyria — that is, Tilgathpilneser king of Assyria — and he deported the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, taking them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and the Gozan River, where they remain to this day.
